Docs.summary: When applied to a method, specifies that the method is called during deserialization of an object in an object graph. The order of deserialization relative to other objects in the graph is non-deterministic.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.OnDeserializingAttribute> to set default values during deserialization. For example, if the type that you are deserializing does not contain a constructor, create a method to set values of any fields in the instance and apply the attribute to the method.
To use the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.OnDeserializingAttribute>, the method must contain a <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> parameter. The attribute marks the method to be called by the serialization infrastructure and the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> provides additional data about the type of serialization taking place. The usage is shown in the following code:
[!code-csharp[System.Runtime.Serialization.OnSerialization#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Serialization.OnSerialization/CS/OnSerializationOnDeserializationExample.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Runtime.Serialization.OnSerialization#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Serialization.OnSerialization/VB/OnSerializationOnDeserializationExample.vb#4)]
> [!NOTE] > In your code, you can use the word `OnDeserializing` instead of the longer <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.OnDeserializingAttribute>.
## Examples The following example applies the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.OnDeserializedAttribute>, <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.OnSerializingAttribute>, <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.OnSerializedAttribute>, and <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.OnDeserializingAttribute> attributes to methods in a class.
